plugin.name: Hadar_discord_webhook
plugin.author: Hadar
plugin.purpose: trigger stuff to webhook of discord

trigger.match: ^\[\s+10 minutes of double exp started courtesy of (.*)\s+\]$
^Double experience for 10 minutes courtesy of (.*)'s daily blessing.$
^You hear a loud roar from (.*) and the world appears calmer for a while..$

muclient.script:
local json = require("json") local ltn12 = require("ltn12") local discordURL = "PUT WEBHOOK URL HERE!!!!" async_ok, async = pcall (require, "async") thread = nil
function fifteendouble(name,line,wildcards) discordSendMessage(wildcards[1],"15") end
function tendouble(name,line,wildcards) discordSendMessage(wildcards[1],"10") end
function hourdouble(name,line,wildcards) discordSendMessage(wildcards[1],"60") end
function discordSendMessage(reason,time) if async_ok and not thread then thread = async.request(discordURL, "HTTPS") end local payload = {} local body = {} body["headers"]={}
if time == "60" then payload["content"] = "@here "..time.." minutes of double thanks to "..reason else payload["content"] = time.." minutes of double thanks to "..reason end payload["tts"] = false
retval, page, status, headers, full_status = thread:join() thread = nil if status == 200 then -- 200 is the HTTP status code for "OK" local encode = json.encode(payload)
body.headers["content-type"] = "application/json" body["source"] = encode
async.doAsyncRemoteRequest(discordURL, result_function, "HTTPS", 120, timeout_function, body)
else print("access error") end end
function result_function(retval, page, status, headers, full_status, requested_url, request_body)
end
function timeout_function() print("Timed out") end
